alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Northern Blaine County; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 10:39AM MST until December 23 at 8:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 3 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
